intro: Cinchona delondriana, commonly known as the Delondriana quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, and it is closely related to other cinchona species used historically for quinine production. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves and a preference for moist, shaded environments in its natural habitat.
